summary: This document is an email chain between law firms and an FBI agent regarding the review of videos from Jeffrey Epstein's estate. The emails discuss the discovery of a video that may contain child pornography during a court-ordered review, and coordination for meetings between legal representatives and law enforcement.

persons.name: Hilary McDonnell
persons.role: Associate at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP
persons.context: Legal representative for one of the co-executors of the Epstein estate; coordinates meetings with the FBI regarding the review of videos from the estate.

persons.name: Wilson Wang
persons.context: Copied on email discussing the Epstein estate video review.

persons.name: Daniel Weiner
persons.role: Attorney at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP
persons.context: Co-counsel at Hughes Hubbard referenced as being involved in the video review and correspondence with the FBI.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.context: Copied on emails regarding the Epstein estate video review.

persons.name: Daniel Ruzumna
persons.role: Attorney at Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler LLP
persons.context: Represents one of the two co-executors of the Epstein estate; describes the video review process and the discovery of a potentially illicit video.

persons.name: Tara Norris
persons.context: Copied on emails regarding the Epstein estate.

persons.name: Jean Lau
persons.context: Copied on emails regarding the Epstein estate.

persons.name: Jed Rakoff
persons.context: U.S. District Court judge who signed the 'Order regarding Review of Videomaterials' for the Epstein estate video review.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased individual whose estate is the subject of the document review; videos were pulled from his emails and files.

connections.description: Co-counsel representing different co-executors of the Epstein estate; coordinate on the video review and communications with the FBI.
Referenced as co-counsel working together on the Epstein estate video review.
Both are attorneys at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP working on the Epstein estate matter.
Ruzumna reaches out to the FBI for guidance after potential child pornography is found in Epstein estate videos.

events.title: Meeting at Hughes Hubbard
events.description: Scheduled meeting between Hilary McDonnell and an FBI special agent to discuss videos from the Epstein estate.

events.title: Discovery of potential CSAM video
events.description: During a court-ordered review of approximately 1,100 videos from Epstein's emails and files, a video that may contain child pornography was identified.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, New York, NY 10004
1133 Avenue of the Americas, New York, New York 10036
U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Approximately 1,100 videos were pulled from Jeffrey Epstein's emails and files for review as part of estate document production obligations.
A video potentially containing child pornography was discovered during the review; it was reportedly shared with Epstein by an individual previously convicted of a child pornography-type offense.
The video review was conducted under a court-ordered protocol approved by Judge Jed Rakoff to provide legal protection to reviewers.
The Epstein estate had entered into a settlement with the Government of the U.S. Virgin Islands and was responding to subpoenas from SDNY litigation.
Law firms involved took precautions not to download videos to their servers, using a document collection vendor for processing.
